content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    code_blocks = []
    current_code_block = nothing

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, r"\`\`\`")
            current_code_block = []
            pushfirst!(code_blocks, String[])
        elseif !isempty(current_code_block)
            push!(current_code_block, line)
        elseif endswith(line, r"\`\`\`")
            push!(code_blocks[end], join(current_code_block, "\n"))
            current_code_block = nothing
        else
            continue
        end
    end

    return join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown string as its argument, extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences, and joins the code blocks together with newlines. It returns a single string containing all the extracted code blocks.
